The Little Book of Deep Learning

A comprehensive guide to deep learning by Francois Fleuret, a professor at the University of Geneva, Switzerland. The book covers the foundations of machine learning, efficient computation, and deep models, including layer types, activation functions, pooling, dropout, normalizing layers, skip connections, attention layers, token embedding, and positional encoding. It also explores multi-layer perceptrons and convolutional architectures.
